org.zeromq.ZMsg

type
class
available in
cpp

The ZMsg class provides methods to send and receive multipart messages across 0MQ sockets. This class provides a list-like container interface, with methods to work with the overall container. ZMsg messages are composed of zero or more ZFrame objects. 

  // Send a simple single-frame string message on a ZMQSocket "output" socket object
  ZMsg.newStringMsg("Hello").send(output);

  // Add several frames into one message
  var msg:ZMsg = new ZMsg();
  for (i in 0 ... 10) {
      msg.addString("Frame" + i);
  }
  msg.send(output);

  // Receive message from ZMQSocket "input" socket object and iterate over frames
  var receivedMessage = ZMsg.recvMsg(input);
  for (f in receivedMessage) {
      // Do something with frame f (of type ZFrame)
  }

Based on zmsg.c in czmq

Static Methods

load(file : neko.io.FileInput, ?msg : ZMsg) : ZMsg

parameters
file
?msg
returns
Load / append a ZMsg from an open file. Create a new message if null message provided.

newStringMsg(data : String) : ZMsg

parameters
data
returns
Simple method that adds a single supplied string to a new ZMsg, and returns the message object

recvMsg(socket : ZMQSocket) : ZMsg

parameters
socket
returns
Receives message from socket, returns ZMsg object or null if the recv was interrupted. Does a blocking recv, if you want not to block then use the ZLoop class or ZMQPoller to check for socket input before receiving.

save(msg : ZMsg, file : neko.io.FileOutput) : Bool

parameters
msg
file
returns
Save message to an open file, return true if OK, else false Data saved as: 4 bytes: number of frames For every frame: 4 bytes: byte size of frame + bytes: frame data bytes

Constructor

new()
Constructor

Instance Methods

add(frame : ZFrame) : Void

parameters
frame ZFrame to add to list
throws
ZMQException if frame is null
Add a ZFrame to end of list

addString(str : String) : Void

parameters
str
Adds string as new ZFrame at front of ZMsg frame list

contentSize() : Int

returns
Return number of bytes contained in all the frames in this message

destroy() : Void

Destructor. Destroys all ZFrames stored in ZMsg

duplicate() : ZMsg

returns
Copied ZMsg object, or null if this message contains an invalid (destroyed) frame list.
Creates copy of this message, also copying all contained frames & their data

filter(f : ZFrame -> Bool) : ZMsg

parameters
f
returns
Filtered ZMsg object, else null if this message contains no frame list (ie has been destroyed)
Returns a new ZMsg object containing only those ZFrames from this message where f(x) is true

first() : ZFrame

returns
Returns last frame in message, else null if frame list is empty or invalid (destroyed)

isEmpty() : Bool

returns
returns True if the ZMsg has no frames, else false

iterator() : Iterator<ZFrame>

returns
Returns an iterator over the ZFrame list within the ZMsg

last() : ZFrame

returns
Returns last frame in message, else null if frame list is empty or invalid (destroyed)

pop() : ZFrame

returns
Removes first frame from message, if any. Returns frame or null. Caller now owns frame and must destroy() it when finished with it.

popString() : String

returns
Pop frame off top of message, returns as a String, else null if no frames in message, or if popped frame has no data.

push(frame : ZFrame) : Void

parameters
frame
Push frame to the front of the message, before all the other frames. ZMsg object takes ownership of the frame, will destroy it when message is sent.

pushString(str : String) : Void

parameters
str
Pushes string as new ZFrame at front of ZMsg frame list

remove(frame : ZFrame) : Bool

parameters
frame ZFrame to remove
returns
true if frame is found and removed, else false
Removes an existing frame from the message. Does not destroy the removed frame.

send(socket : ZMQSocket) : Void

parameters
socket
Send message to socket, destroys after sending. If the message has no frames, sends nothing but destroys the message anyhow.

size() : Int

Return number of frames in message
